title: England's back-row baby-faced assassins Tom Curry and Sam Underhill have formed a precocious but formidable partnership
text:
Tom Curry, one of the England back-row’s baby-faced assassins, has drawn an extraordinary compliment from Ben Youngs. “I’m sure he’ll go on to be one of the greatest back-rowers England have ever had,” says Eddie Jones’ first-choice scrum-half.

From the No 9 position Youngs has a good view of Curry, 21, and Sam Underhill, 23, who look like a pair of undergraduates but tackle and turn the ball over like professors of back-row play. You would never guess, looking at them side by side at the England team hotel, that these two diminutive flankers had shut down Australia’s Michael Hooper and David Pocock in Oita.

Underhill made a list-topping 20 tackles in that quarter-final victory and Curry won...
description: Tom Curry, one of the England back-row’s baby-faced assassins, has drawn an extraordinary compliment from Ben Youngs.
